decks.notes: The main focus of this Mono White Control deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing removal spells, counterspells, and powerful late-game threats. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Lay Down Arms and Get Lost, while also generating card advantage and value with cards like Caretaker's Talent and Enduring Innocence. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Voice of Victory allows the deck to close out the game once it has stabilized. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of lands and support cards to ensure consistency and flexibility in various matchups.

This deck focuses on early aggression and spell-based damage to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing low cost creatures and instant/sorcery spells, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game. The inclusion of card draw and mana fixers ensures consistency in drawing threats and maintaining a steady flow of resources. With a mix of direct damage spells and efficient creatures, this deck aims to end the game swiftly before the opponent has time to stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent while also disrupting their strategy with targeted discard and removal spells. The deck also includes some higher-cost creatures that can close out the game or provide additional benefits. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy by allowing for consistent casting of spells. Additionally, the inclusion of specific lands and spells provides additional synergy and power to the deck's overall strategy.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on generating early game aggression and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to control the board through temporary lockdown effects while building a strong board presence with resilient threats like Sunpearl Kirin and Loran of the Third Path. By effectively utilizing creature abilities and strong removal like Go for the Throat, the deck seeks to quickly apply pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle with a Mono Black Aggro archetype. The key concept revolves around quickly building a threatening board presence with powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Duress and Cut Down. The deck also includes removal spells like Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. By utilizing a combination of aggression and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and secure a victory.
